summary: Beverly Jackson was an employee of the Select Committee on Assassinations (SCA). She is listed in multiple payroll certification reports from 1978 and 1979, indicating her employment during that period. The documents provide her name and potentially her salary, although the specific details of her role within the committee are not specified in these documents.
significance: Beverly Jackson's significance lies in her employment with the Select Committee on Assassinations, suggesting she was involved in the investigation into the JFK assassination, although the extent and nature of her involvement are not detailed in the provided documents.
